description.p: Cleanux is a powerful system cleaning utility designed to keep your Linux system running smoothly.

ul.li: Cache cleaning
Trash management
Log file optimization

System service management

description.p: Resolved persistent build issues and harmonized documentation across projects:

ul.li: Fixed Tauri version mismatch in CI by updating Cargo.lock and aligning crate versions.
Standardized README structure and screenshot galleries across Cleanux, TaskFlow, and Translator projects.
Optimized build dependency declarations in Cargo.toml for improved stability.
Synchronized project metadata and release notes across all distribution formats.

description.p: Fixed package resolution and cleaned up dependencies:

ul.li: Corrected @tauri-apps/cli version to ensure successful installation on CI environments.
Removed duplicate @angular/material dependencies from package.json.
Synchronized version 0.1.2 across all project configuration files.

description.p: Fixed build system compatibility and enhanced project documentation:

ul.li: Synchronized Tauri NPM packages and Rust crate versions to 2.10.1 to resolve build mismatches.
Added automated Flatpak build workflow using GitHub Actions.
Integrated comprehensive screenshot galleries and improved README documentation.
Optimized AppImage bundling by explicitly configuring square icons in Tauri settings.

description.p: Initial release of Cleanux - A comprehensive system cleaning and optimization utility.

ul.li: Comprehensive file cleaning service with parallel processing for cache, logs, and trash.
System service management for controlling and monitoring background processes.
Large file detection to help identify and manage disk space usage.
Modern Angular v21 frontend with real-time scanning and tabbed interface.
Modular backend architecture with Rust-based controllers, services, and models.
Dark mode support with theme persistence.
Automated build system with Flatpak packaging and GitHub Actions integration.
Optimized project structure following standardized naming conventions and modular design.
